```{r}
library(ape)
library(geiger)

# Create a random phylogenetic tree
set.seed(123)
tree <- rtree(10)

# Define the parameters for the OU process
alpha1 <- 0.5
alpha2 <- 1.0
sigma1 <- 0.1
sigma2 <- 0.2

# Function to simulate the OU process
sim_OU <- function(t, alpha, sigma) {
  x <- numeric(length(t))
  x[1] <- rnorm(1, 0, sigma / sqrt(2 * alpha))
  for (i in 2:length(t)) {
    x[i] <- x[i-1] + alpha * (0 - x[i-1]) * (t[i] - t[i-1]) + 
      sigma * rnorm(1)
  }
  return(x)
}

# Function to simulate the OU process on a tree
sim_OU_tree <- function(tree, alpha, sigma) {
  tip_states <- lapply(tree$tip.label, function(x) {
    t <- c(0, cumsum(diff(tree$edge.length[tree$edge[,1] == x])))
    sim_OU(t, alpha, sigma)
  })
  return(tip_states)
}

# Simulate the OU process on the tree with different regimes
tip_states1 <- sim_OU_tree(tree, alpha1, sigma1)
tip_states2 <- sim_OU_tree(tree, alpha2, sigma2)

# Combine the two sets of tip states
tip_states <- c(tip_states1, tip_states2)

# Plot the simulated data on the tree
plot_tree_continuous_traits(tree, tip_states, 
  xlim = c(-2, 2), ylim = c(-2, 2))

```
